thread.title: Kristy Mirzikinian's reaction over Sydney sinkhole
thread.title_full: Kristy Mirzikinian's reaction over Sydney sinkhole | Daily Mail Online

author: Kate Darvall For Daily Mail Australia
title: Kristy Mirzikinian's reaction over Sydney sinkhole
text:
She became an overnight sensation after a sinkhole opened up outside her home in one of Australia's most affluent suburbs, now she is being heralded as Australia's sinkhole sweetheart.
Point Piper resident Kristy Mirzikinian was thrust into the spotlight on Wednesday when she unleashed a hilariously frank and honest television interview about the gaping hole that opened up in Wentworth Street, Point Piper.
While the sinkhole took most residents by surprise, Ms Mirzikinian said it left her in a particularly terrible predicament.
Kristy Mirzikinian had a sinking sensation of a different kind when the giant hole opened up outside her home in the harbourside suburb of Point Piper
'My personal trainer has come, my electricity is off and now I don't know what to do,' she said dressed in blue active wear and clutching a Mercedes Benz umbrella.
'Honestly I'm in shock. I'm in shock right now because I've come home and there's a massive hole opposite my house.'
The American-born blonde beauty describes herself as an aspiring actor and model online.
'My name is Kristy Mirzikinian, I've lived in Australia for 10 years. I moved to Australia from California when I was 18,' she said.
'I don't have any acting experience but I'm willing to give it a try.'
Kristy Mirzikinian with her husband Warwick Mirzikinian - who is a high-flying poker champion
Kristy Mirzikinian (left) runs with high profile socialites in Sydney, where she lives in Point Piper
'My name is Kristy Mirzikinian, I've lived in Australia for 10 years. I moved to Australia from California when I was 18,' she wrote online
'I don't have any acting experience but I'm willing to give it a try!' she added to her profile
While her acting career may not have taken off, her IMDb page credits her in a 15-minute short comedy filmed in Australia in 2011.
Since moving to Australia when she was 18, Ms Mirzikinian has made her way into Australia's 'it' scene.
Photographed alongside PR Queen Roxy Jacenko at prestigious charity events, she appears to be living the high life.
She also lives with her husband in one of Australia's most affluent suburbs, just 500 metres from Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull's home.
Her husband Warwick Mirzikinian is a high-flying poker champion.
The Point Piper local (right) in happier times: pictured with Roxy Jacenko (left) at a 2016 Melbourne Cup luncheon hosted by the PR Queen
Rubbing shoulder with Sydney's elite: Ms Mirzikinian (right) pictured with Roxy Jacenko (left) and Emma Steel (centre)
Kristy Mirzikinian with her husband Warwick, who live together in Point Piper, where the sinkhole opened up in February
In just two days, January 6 and 7 this year, he won $8,370 in a No Limit Hold'em championship.
Mr Mirzikinian had $245,770 in earnings throughout his World Series of Poker career, but says he played 'just for fun', according to his Australian Gambling profile.
He won $162,443 in a poker competition in 2012, which required a $5000 buy in.
He currently ranks number 89 on Australia's All Time Money List.
He was also a director at retailer Strathfield, and owner of telecom company m8.
Meanwhile the swimming pool sized sinkhole which catapulted Ms Mirzikinian to fame remains put â€“ blocking traffic, cutting power and interrupting personal training sessions.
Mr Mirzikinian's poker history is detailed on World Series Poker - including a list of some of his big wins
In just two days, January 6 and 7 this year, he won $8,370 in a No Limit Hold'em championship
Mr Mirzikinian's statistics and rankings in poker are listed on the World Series Poker site
'My personal trainer has come, my electricity is off and now I don't know what to do,' said Ms Mirzikinian in her blue gym gear and clutching a Mercedes Benz umbrella
Standing in her driveway opposite the sinkhole, Ms Mirzikinian said she noticed a gas leak on Tuesday afternoon.
'We did smell a gas leak in the afternoon and the guys came and they were banging around, breaking down the concrete,' she said.
'Basically we woke up and it was like this.'
The six bedroom, eight bathroom mansion closest to the sinkhole has been listed for auction online.
The real estate agent representing the property refused to comment whether the large hole in front of the house would affect the price or auction date.
The sinkhole, the size of a backyard swimming pool, not only blocked traffic and cut power but it also interrupted personal training sessions
A worker inspects the sinkhole that appeared after heavy rain outside a property located near Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull's residence in Point Piper
A Woollahra Council spokeswoman said a small hole was reported on Tuesday evening at the site and emergency services were called early on Wednesday as the sinkhole opened up.
Four properties on the affected side of the road were then evacuated by police.
The sinkhole has been made safe by geo-tech engineers, the spokeswoman said.
However the occupants of the home immediately affected by the hole, measuring about 15m by 3m and about 2m deep, were not at home on Wednesday, she said.
A woman looks into a sinkhole which opened up in the suburb of Point Piper in Sydney on Wednesday
